text:
Hi there ! I got a problem retrieving data from the API (<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/engagements/engagements-overview>)

For example the API send me task suppressed by users on HubSpot. Is it normal ?

<https://app.HubSpot.com/contacts/467832/lists/17448|H>i,

I'm having trouble ensuring that internal staff (who are likely cookied) logging into our service using a personal email address (via a "non-HubSpot" form that's tracked). These contacts' email addresses get updated on login.

The problem is that, even though I've manually opted out those personal emails, they still get sent as our newsletter is sent as transnational.

Is there any way to ensure that a user's primary email address doesn't change? Ex, if both are on their record and I make the correct one the "primary" one and they log in again...can I ensure that we don't email that personal email address?
How would I go about requesting tickets from the tickets API, filtered by updated date? I don't want or need tickets that haven't been updated in the last 72 hours.

contacts are usually de-duped using email address, so the system would usually consider those to be separate contact records, eh?

something does not totally add up here...
We need a lot more detail to answer this
I think the last form you fill out, that is the email address that you use -- that is what the new email address is
You can have internal users use <https://www.ghostery.com/> or something similar.
Or this is a training issue...
also this is not likely an api question
